item.title: Vision and Reasoning
item.description:
Many vision and language tasks require commonsense reasoning beyond data-driven image and natural language processing. Cognitive Sciences and older Active Vision literature points to an explicit iterative interaction between perception, reasoning and memeory (knowledge) modules (ACS paper).

We have proposed instantiations of this abstract architecture to solve image puzzles, VQA and visual reasoning tasks such as CLEVR. In our AAAI 2018 VQA, and UAI 2018 Puzzles, we have proposed an explicit probabilistic soft logic layer on top of a neural architecture that helps integrate commonsense knowledge and induces post-hoc interpretability.

Later on, for an end-to-end (differentiable) integration of spatial knowledge, we explore a combination of knowledge distillation, probabilistic logic, and relational network in our WACV 2019 CLEVR.
